dt: {bc}someone (such as a priest) who {a_link|officiates} at a religious rite

et: borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}officiant-, officians,{/it} present participle of {it}officiāre{/it} "to perform a function, perform priestly duties" {ma}{mat|officiate|}{/ma}
shortdef: someone (such as a priest) who officiates at a religious rite
